climbs.name: Tom's Traverse
climbs.fa: Tom Sullivan 1976 Varration Dan Osman solo 1982

content.description: Starts by the Creek A finger crack leads up to the sandy ledge on the right. Follow cracks up to the class ledges at top.
content.location: To the Right of Color Me Gone

content.description: Route 1 in photo.  A good training climb for beginners.
content.protection: Pro to 2 inches. Two-bolt anchor at top. 4th-class descent off to left.

content.description: Really good stemming and hand jams. At about the 3/4 mark, start traversing right. New anchors in the middle of the face remove any concerns about bad protection.
content.protection: Trad (pro to 1"). 2 bolt anchors in the middle of the face
content.location: There are basically two primary dihedrials right next to each other.  This is the one on the left.  Climb directly in the corner.  Use the chains of Big Bang.

content.description: Climb the Creek facing side of the pillar that Blood Shot is on.  Route stay in middle of the pillar climbing cracks  then 20 feet from the top start to lieback the arete of the left side up to the double bolt anchors.
content.location: Right corner of Bloodshot facing the stream

content.description: Lizard King 5.11 b. Climb on the right side of the arete using face moves and the inside wall of the center chimney. Rap off the two bolt anchor or walk off the back side.
content.location: 6. on the latest topo. This route lies between Edge of Doom and End of Time the  5th class chimney.

climbs.name: The Left Seam
climbs.fa: Tom Sullivan, Bill Nagel and Ron Anderson (1977)

content.description: Shares anchors with Green Hell and Color Me Gone. Climb broken crack to big jugs.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus long draws for the anchors.
content.location: Just to the right of End of Time Dihedrial.

content.description: Bold, X rated.  Climb through really small crimps and make hard first clip high off the ground.  By the time you make it to the second clip, you have ground fall potential again.  Old Dan Osman Route.  Shares anchors with The Left Seam and Color Me Gone.
content.location: Right in the middle of The Right Seam and Color Me Gone.

content.description: "A dirty slot leads up to a rock filled ledge on the inside of an awkward chimney which is followed to fourth class ledges at the top."
content.location: When you first cross the creek, take a right. This is the big dihedral. Climb the chimney! (updated based on Ron's feedback, to distinguish from the mix up in Mike's Falcon guide. - ed.)

content.description: Route 2 in photo.  Another good training climb.
content.protection: 5 bolts, 2-bolt anchor at top. 4th-class descent off to left.  A safety bolt for the Belayer is left of the start to keep beyayer & climbers from falling off ledge

content.description: Most free solo this as a warm up.  Can be led and top roped using the same chains as Big Bang.
content.location: Of the two prominent diherdials right next to each other, this is the one on the right. To the left of The left Seam and to the right fo Lizard King.

content.description: Face climbing, really thin crimps and balancy moves.
content.location: Just around the arete from PA Corner and Big Bang.  Climb on the north face.  Shares anchors with Big Bang.

content.description: Route 14 in photo.  The first climb you see as you come out ot the trees from the parking area. Climb the short face to the first bolt and follow the arete to the left. Transition to the face on your right and continue straight up.
content.protection: 8 bolts, 2-bolt anchor at top with chains.

climbs.name: Color Me Gone
climbs.fa: Tom Sullivan, Bill Nagel and Ron Anderson (1977)

content.description: Start right under Green Hell and traverse up and right to the prominent bulge/crack.  Bring 2" cam to protect before first bolt, otherwise run out with bad fall potential.  Climb up crack system, Clip third bolt, and traverse left.  These are some fun moves. Finish up on the Left Seam.
content.location: Just to the right of Green Hell and The Left Seam.

content.description: This line takes the lip of roof on the right side to to a bolt on the face then to the summit block.  Shown as the Blue line.
content.location: Start at Tom's Travers and climb up to corner under roof.

content.description: Use the crack for pro for first thirty feet. Head towards the bolts on center of face. Balancing moves on small potato chip thin crimps make this a solid 5.10 a face climb. Using the arete as it is a 5.7 variation for when you find the face climbing is just too committing for you.
content.protection: pro to 1" plus 3 bolts and draws for the top.
content.location: To the Right of the Gash.  Start on the right arete and eventually end up on the face.

content.description: Route 4 in the photo. This route was put up ground up by Mike Carville. It climbs the north face of the pillar to the left of Edge of Doom using the small crimp holds on the face.
Star out at the Big toe of the rock. Climb flakes to a sand ledge follow the corner up under the roof exit left to the anchor system of "Color me Gone"
content.location: Route is just to the left of the roof.

content.description: Climb up chimney pass Chock stone mantle half up route crux is at top when it turns off width.
content.location: This route lies behind Nose Bleed.

content.description:
Located just south of Carson City, Dinosaur Rock has climbs ranging from 5.0 to 5.12. It is an excellent place for learning to climb as it offers both trad and sport climbs. The rock is deteriorated granite, but solid. It is right next to Clear Creek, so there is plenty of shade in the summer. However, the east side climbs are exposed to the sun most of the day. Best time to climb there is from late spring to early fall. It's not usually crowded. In my photos, I have only indicated the beginning and end of the climbs as most of climbs are bolted or follow obvious lines. In the future I will add updated photos.

 If you need more specifics there (used to be) a good rendering of Dinosuar Rock at Lon and Kelle' Harter's website at harter-climbing.aci.net/Hom…

(editor's note: now defunct).

 There is a Super Wal-Mart at the junction of Highway 395 and Clear Creek Road, if you need supplies before or after you climb.
